reviewText: Excellent movie. Bring you back to the true atmosphere of polish times. Very realistic!!!!

very good movie.
too much to write about.

One of the best movies I have ever seen! Director's masterpiece capturing the history in the bacground, the culture of Polish People, and of course the Profesor Doctor Religa balancing all this to give people hope of life.....
"Bogowie" is a real Hit! Absolutely incredible movie about breaking limits of life!

I think that Bogowie (2014) and Miasto 44 (2014) are the two best Polish productions from last year.

Bogowie (Gods), is an autobiographical film on Zbigniew Religa (1938-2009), who was the most prominent Polish cardiac surgeon and later in his life a politician. The film only concentrates on the years from late 1970's to mid 1980's, and on the attempts of Religa and his loyal and hard working staff at the heart transplants.  The first successful transplant performed by Religa and his staff happened on November 5, 1985.  However the patient dies few days later from some complications.  In addition, the movie also concentrates a little on Religa's personal life, and his relations with wife and his staff.

The film authentically depicts the communist Poland from the well created sets to clothing, cars, furniture, and atmosphere.
A true Polish hero, and a film that captures his amazing achievement - from Michael Sosnkowski, grandson of General Kazimierz Sosnkowski.
It depicts life in Poland in the 1980s so very well. The struggles and opportunities during those days were so great. Cinematography was just amazing!
Thank you so much for the movie! Really liked it!!
It's a very inspiring and intriguing movie.
Universal story about having a dream and fighting for it. Against all odds, against powers that be, agianst one's own weeknesses.
Moivie was okay but still the story can be taken more active and more engaging
